org.apache.paimon.data.serializer

Class BinaryRowSerializer

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.paimon.data.serializer.AbstractRowDataSerializer<BinaryRow>
      • org.apache.paimon.data.serializer.BinaryRowSerializer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, PagedTypeSerializer<BinaryRow>, Serializer<BinaryRow>

    public class BinaryRowSerializer
extends AbstractRowDataSerializer<BinaryRow>
    Serializer for BinaryRow.

    • Method Detail

      • duplicate

        public BinaryRowSerializer duplicate()
        Description copied from interface: Serializer
        Creates a deep copy of this serializer if it is necessary, i.e. if it is stateful. This can return itself if the serializer is not stateful.

        We need this because Serializers might be used in several threads. Stateless serializers are inherently thread-safe while stateful serializers might not be thread-safe.

        Serializes the given record to the given target output view.

        Throws:
        IOException - Thrown, if the serialization encountered an I/O related error. Typically raised by the output view, which may have an underlying I/O channel to which it delegates.

      • serializeToPages

        public int serializeToPages(BinaryRow record,
                            AbstractPagedOutputView headerLessView)
                     throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: PagedTypeSerializer
        Serializes the given record to the given target paged output view. Some implementations may skip some bytes if current page does not have enough space left, .e.g BinaryRow.
        Parameters:
        record - The record to serialize.
        headerLessView - The output view to write the serialized data to.
        Returns:
        Returns the skipped number of bytes.
        Throws:
        IOException - Thrown, if the serialization encountered an I/O related error. Typically raised by the output view, which may have an underlying I/O channel to which it delegates.

        Throws:

      • deserializeFromPages

        public BinaryRow deserializeFromPages(AbstractPagedInputView headerLessView)
                               throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: PagedTypeSerializer
        De-serializes a record from the given source paged input view. For consistency with serialize format, some implementations may need to skip some bytes of source before de-serializing, .e.g BinaryRow. Typically, the content read from source should be copied out when de-serializing, and we are not expecting the underlying data from source is reused. If you have such requirement, see #mapFromPages(T, AbstractPagedInputView).
        Parameters:
        headerLessView - The input view from which to read the data.
        Returns:
        The de-serialized element.
        Throws:
        IOException - Thrown, if the de-serialization encountered an I/O related error. Typically raised by the input view, which may have an underlying I/O channel from which it reads.

      • deserializeFromPages

        public BinaryRow deserializeFromPages(BinaryRow reuse,
                                      AbstractPagedInputView headerLessView)
                               throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: PagedTypeSerializer
        Reuse version of PagedTypeSerializer.deserializeFromPages(AbstractPagedInputView).
        Throws:
        IOException

      • mapFromPages

        public BinaryRow mapFromPages(BinaryRow reuse,
                              AbstractPagedInputView headerLessView)
                       throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: PagedTypeSerializer
        Map a reused record from the given source paged input view. This method provides a possibility to achieve zero copy when de-serializing. You can either choose copy or not copy the content read from source, but we encourage to make it zero copy.

        If you choose the zero copy way, you have to deal with the lifecycle of the pages properly.

        Parameters:
        reuse - the reused record to be mapped
        headerLessView - The input view from which to read the data.
        Returns:
        The mapped record.
        Throws:
        IOException - Thrown, if the de-serialization encountered an I/O related error. Typically raised by the input view, which may have an underlying I/O channel from which it reads.

      • skipRecordFromPages

        Description copied from interface: PagedTypeSerializer

      • checkSkipReadForFixLengthPart

        public void checkSkipReadForFixLengthPart(AbstractPagedInputView source)
                                   throws IOException
        We need skip bytes to read when the remain bytes of current segment is not enough to write binary row fixed part. See BinaryRow.
        Throws:
        IOException
